title: An Introduction to shiny
description: A module in the R Learning Series for PSRC.
contents:
After wrapping up the course on ggplot2 in January 2021, I quickly switched gears to prepare for a two-part session on shiny for PSRC’s virtual R Learning Series.
The two-part series totaled a little over 3 hours. Topics ranged from how to get started to building the UI, creating the server logic, styling with packages (shinythemes, bslib) and CSS, and deployment.
The course website was created using distill and slides were created with xaringan and xaringanextra.

Event: R Learning Series 2020-21 @ Puget Sound Regional CouncilDate: April 27, 2021 & May 11, 2021Github Source Code, class material

title: An Introduction to ggplot2
description: A module in the R Learning Series for PSRC
contents:
I had the opportunity to teach ggplot2 as part of PSRC’s virtual R Learning Series. The R Learning Series began in the Fall of 2020 and consists of 9 modules–each 1.5 hours, to teach staff about R. Topics ranged from the fundamentals to specific packages and statistical methods.
The course website was created using a mix of Rmarkdown and custom HTML and CSS with Bootstrap styling.

Event: R Learning Series 2020-21 @ Puget Sound Regional CouncilDate: January 12th, 2021Github Source Code

title: Hello World
description: Building my first personal site with `distill` by R
contents:
Hello World! Welcome to my very first distill site (yes, this site that you’re browsing through!). I started building this website as part of an exercise in a workshop offered to recipients of RStudio’s 2021 Diversity Scholarship.
In the last several years, I’ve been interested in honing my front-end development skills. I’ve had a primer with HTML, CSS, and a tiny dose of JavaScript. I’ve been meaning to create a site for my portolio but I’ve consistently delayed working on it because I needed to brush up on vue.js and JavaScript. When I learned about RStudio’s distill through the Introduce Yourself Online workshop I was delighted.
I’ll go back to learning JavaScript and vue.js eventually but for now, moaR R!
